p: The aerial parts (leaves) of the Ocimum viride Willd. were harvested at inflorescence initiation stage from fields of CSIR-Indian Institute of Integrative Medicine, Jammu, India. The plant was deposited at the herbarium of department of Botany, University of Jammu, Jammu with voucher number (HBJU-16097). EO was extracted immediately after collection of plant material by hydro-distillation using modified clevenger apparatus for 30 min to 2 h ( Bhagat et al., 2016). The oil samples were dried over anhydrous sodium sulphate (Na2SO4) and stored at 4 °C for future analysis.
